about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must:

about.name: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must:

hasPart.assesses: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must: | If a traffic signal light is not working, you must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

comment.text: Stop, then proceed when safe.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop before entering the intersection and let all other traffic go first.

comment.text: Stop before entering the intersection and let all other traffic go first.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down or stop, only if necessary.

comment.text: Slow down or stop, only if necessary.
Stop, then proceed when safe.

answerExplanation.text: If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

comment.text: If a traffic signal light is not working, you must: | If a traffic signal is not working and no lights are showing, you should proceed cautiously as if the intersection is controlled by stop signs in all directions.

hasPart.name: U-turns in business districts are:
hasPart.assesses: U-turns in business districts are: | U-turns in business districts are: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

suggestedAnswer.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.

comment.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.

comment.text: Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.

suggestedAnswer.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

comment.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

acceptedAnswer.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

comment.text: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

answerExplanation.text: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

comment.text: U-turns in business districts are: | In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: U-turns in business districts are: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem:

about.name: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem:

hasPart.assesses: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem: | If your vehicle has a mechanical problem: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle breaks down on a highway, make sure other drivers can see it. Get your vehicle off the road and away from traffic if at all possible and turn on your emergency flashers to show that you are having trouble.

suggestedAnswer.text: Signal and pull into the slow lane.

comment.text: Signal and pull into the slow lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop in your lane and put on your hazard lights.

comment.text: Stop in your lane and put on your hazard lights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Put on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

comment.text: Put on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

acceptedAnswer.text: Put on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

comment.text: Put on your hazard lights and pull off the road.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle breaks down on a highway, make sure other drivers can see it. Get your vehicle off the road and away from traffic if at all possible and turn on your emergency flashers to show that you are having trouble.

comment.text: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem: | If your vehicle breaks down on a highway, make sure other drivers can see it. Get your vehicle off the road and away from traffic if at all possible and turn on your emergency flashers to show that you are having trouble.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

comment.text: Two-way traffic.
Change in direction ahead.
School zone and crossing.
Two-way traffic.

answerExplanation.text: This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

comment.text: This sign means: | This sign informs drivers that they are leaving a divided roadway and approaching a two-way highway.

hasPart.name: You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement:

about.name: You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement:

hasPart.assesses: You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement: | You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must have evidence of financial responsibility, such as proof of insurance, with you whenever you drive. You must always show proof of insurance and your license to an officer upon request after a traffic stop or collision.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only if you are involved in a collision.

comment.text: Only if you are involved in a collision.

suggestedAnswer.text: If you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.

comment.text: If you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only if you are stopped and cited.

comment.text: Only if you are stopped and cited.

acceptedAnswer.text: If you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.

comment.text: If you are involved in a collision or stopped for a citation.

answerExplanation.text: You must have evidence of financial responsibility, such as proof of insurance, with you whenever you drive. You must always show proof of insurance and your license to an officer upon request after a traffic stop or collision.

comment.text: You must show proof of insurance to law enforcement: | You must have evidence of financial responsibility, such as proof of insurance, with you whenever you drive. You must always show proof of insurance and your license to an officer upon request after a traffic stop or collision.

hasPart.name: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

about.name: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?

hasPart.assesses: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? | A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.

comment.text: Honk and step on the brake firmly.

suggestedAnswer.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

comment.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

suggestedAnswer.text: Swerve into the lane next to you.

comment.text: Swerve into the lane next to you.

acceptedAnswer.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

comment.text: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

answerExplanation.text: If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

comment.text: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? | If a vehicle merges in front of you too closely, take your foot off of the accelerator. This will create space between you and the vehicle ahead without requiring you to slam on your brakes or swerve into another lane.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: A vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you, creating a hazard. What should you do first?
